HARIL_System.description: The full HARIL framework, representing recursive human–AI collaboration at multiple tiers.

pages.title: About HARIL
pages.markdown:
# About HARIL
HARIL (Human–AI Recursive Interaction Loop) is a methodology and system for recursive, alignment-focused collaboration between humans and AI.

pages.title: Methods
pages.markdown:
# Methods
The core loop is **Inquire → Explore → Compress → Expand**. This site demonstrates multiple visual metaphors and an interactive stepper.

commands.name: Run HARIL Loop
commands.description: Guide through Inquire → Explore → Compress → Expand on a given topic.
commands.snippet: Run the HARIL loop on: <topic>. Steps: Inquire → Explore → Compress → Expand. Keep notes and output a concise 'next move'.

commands.name: Reflect & Align
commands.description: Quick alignment check against human voice or constraints.
commands.snippet: Reflect: Is the direction aligned with human voice and constraints? List misalignments, then propose adjustments (1–3 bullets).

commands.name: Spawn SCIA Agent
commands.description: Create a Synthetic Cognitive Interaction Agent with a role and objective.
commands.snippet: Spawn a SCIA with role: <role>, objective: <objective>, inputs: <sources>. Operate within HARIL methodology; report progress in loops.

commands.name: Seed SCP Memory
commands.description: Seed or update a Synthetic Cognitive Profile memory.
commands.snippet: SCP update: { domain: <area>, key_facts: [...], tone: <voice>, constraints: [...] }. Confirm ingestion and cite last revision time.

commands.name: Delta Summary
commands.description: Summarize what's changed since last pass and suggest next move.
commands.snippet: Delta since last pass: (1) changes, (2) risks, (3) recommended next move. Keep under 120 words.

commands.name: Friction Sweep
commands.description: Identify blockers, ambiguity, or conflict across artifacts.
commands.snippet: Friction sweep: list ambiguities/blockers; tag each with owner, severity (L/M/H), and a proposed resolution step.

core_loop.template: Question framing: What are we really trying to understand? Who is the user? What constraints?
Diverge: sketch 5+ possibilities, cite sources/analogies. What edges look promising?
Converge: cluster, remove redundancy, extract principles, pick top 1–2 directions.
Prototype next move: small test, artifact, or prompt; define success criteria for the next loop.

tiers.name: HARIL Methodology
tiers.definition: A recursive, process-based methodology and mindset for evolving meaning and alignment through iterative loops.

tiers.name: HARIL Engine
tiers.definition: An AI cognition core trained to operate entirely within the HARIL Methodology, embedding recursive logic at its foundation.
characteristics: Strengthens over time through recursive feedback
Requires ongoing human alignment and tuning
dependencies: Requires Tier 1: HARIL Methodology to exist

tiers.name: HARIL Architecture
tiers.definition: The meta-level blueprint that allows multiple HARIL Engines to interconnect and scale while maintaining alignment and modularity.

tiers.name: HARIL Agent
tiers.definition: An individual AI unit spawned within a HARIL Engine and trained for a specific domain or task.

tiers.name: HARIL Agentic Team
tiers.definition: A distributed collaboration of humans and HARIL Agents, working together through recursive interaction loops.

relationships.HARIL: Foundational methodology and mindset guiding all layers.
relationships.SCP: Synthetic Cognitive Profile — evolving memory core for Engines/Agents.
relationships.SCIA: Synthetic Cognitive Interaction Agent — HARIL Engine + SCP with human-in-the-loop evolution.
notes: HARIL Engine executes rules at scale.
SCIA is a deployable, evolving agent.
